msContents.summary:
4 fol. on parchment; Shelfmark: Marcel 128; Qurʾānic Text: Q 13:38-14:5; 7 lines per page; Dimensions: 253 x 176mm; Script style: kūfī D.I.
The fragments Marcel 114, Marcel 125 (NLR) and Arabe 348 (c) (BNF) belongs to the same manuscript.
This entry was created on the basis of the information made available by Valery V. Polosin (1939-2014), without use of manuscript images. Therefore, the exact distribution of the Qurʾānic passages across the manuscript pages is unknown to us, and all the passages are shown as belonging to fol. 1. The catalogue entry by Polosin contains the following information:
"Marcel 128
Fragment: 13:38(38) – 14:5(5).
4 fol. 176×253 mm (1.4375). Support: thin transparent parchment, smooth, of yellowish color. Writing material: dark brown ink.
Collation: one incomplete quire, fol. 2 and 3 are a bifolium, fol. 1 and 4 are singletons with stubs.
I: H1F S H2F / F3H F4H S.
Text layout: 98×172 mm (1.755); 7 lines. Ruling: absent; visible embossed ruling with a sharp pointed instrument for the decorative panel with the surah heading. Script: D I, horizontal elements of some letters are stretched up to 6-8 cm. Diacritics: diagonal dashes in the same ink as the main text. Vocalization: round golden, red, blue black and green dots.
Verse markers: for individual verses –rosettes (type 3.1.2) in gold and colors; for groups for groups of ten verses – medallion (type 5.C.II), in gold and colors, with the inscribed verse number (اربعون – fol. 1r).
Title of surah 14 (ابرهيم خمسون واية) is written in gold and inscribed into the ornamented rectangular panel drawn with gold and colors, with a tree-shaped medallion on the outer margin (fol. 2v).
Inscriptions: numbers of surahs in Roman numerals and the verse numbers in Arabic numerals are inscribed in pencil on the outer margins of all pages; numbers of pages (1, 2, 3) are inscribed on in the upper outer corners of fol. 2r, 2v and 3r.
Defects: minor stains; outer margins are damaged probably by rodents; the aint from the ornamented panel has imprinted on the opposite fol. 3r; parchment on some pages damaged by aggressive ink; ink peeling off on the flesh side and even on the hair side.
Old accession numbers: № 4 (and according to the 2nd Langlois’ inventory).
Contents:
Fol. 1r–2v. Surah 13, verses 38(38)–43(43)*. Incipit: [بإذن الله] لكلّ أجل كتاب.
Fol. 2v–4v. Surah 14, verses 1(1)–5(5). Explicit: إن في ذلك لا[ياتٍ لكلّ صبّار] .
Other fragments of the same manuscript: Marcel 125, Marcel 114 (NLR); Arabe 348c (BNF)."
Olga Yastrebova has translated and sometimes corrected the notes of V. Polosin. Corrected passages are marked with ОЯ (O.Ya).
An image of fol. 2v can be seen on the website of the NLR (No. 4).
